text_block_list.text:
Several days have passed since Winning Ticket's realization about 
how defeat truly feels.
But today she's training as if it were any other day.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: Phew…

text_block_list.name: Gold Ship
text_block_list.text: Ack… This ship's running on fumes… Just about break time I'd say!

text_block_list.name: Mejiro McQueen
text_block_list.text:
Why would you use all your energy warming up?! I expect you to train 
seriously!

One thing, however, is different. She isn't back to her usual, 
enthusiastic self.

text_block_list.name: Gold Ship
text_block_list.text:
By the by, I'm seeing a lot of people with cameras around the course. 
What's that about?

text_block_list.name: Mejiro McQueen
text_block_list.text:
Reporters sniffing around for a story no doubt. Today is a public 
training day.

text_block_list.name: Gold Ship
text_block_list.text: Ah, now it makes sense! So the public's here to train with us?

text_block_list.name: Mejiro McQueen
text_block_list.text:
That's not what it means. Whenever a race is approaching, journalists 
come to see how our training is coming along.

text_block_list.name: Mejiro McQueen
text_block_list.text:
And today is public day for the Derby. So there are even more 
reporters than usual it seems.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: Oh, that was today?

This is a good chance to see how the other runners are faring. Let's go 
check out Hayahide and Taishin.

This is a good chance to see how the other runners are faring. Let's go 
check out Hayahide and Taishin.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: Ah, right… Okay.
The Derby runners all gather to start practicing in public view.

text_block_list.name: Reporter A
text_block_list.text:
There's the BNW trio. Narita Taishin won the Satsuki Sho—all eyes'll 
be on her.

text_block_list.name: Reporter B
text_block_list.text:
Biwa Hayahide isn't one to sneeze at either. And she's only going to 
get better from here.

Just as the reporters predicted, Narita Taishin and Biwa Hayahide's 
running sends murmurs through the crowd.

text_block_list.name: Reporter A
text_block_list.text: All right, next is Winning Ticket.

No matter how much they wait though, Winning Ticket doesn't come 
out. I start feeling anxious that something might've happened to her.

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text: Hey, Trainer, you seen Ticket?
No… I thought she headed for public training with you two.
No… I thought she headed for public training with you two.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
She didn't. And she wasn't near the starting line when it was her turn 
to run.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text: Hm, if you don't know…

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text: No… She wouldn't!

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text: H-hey! Taishin!

Taishin and Hayahide leave the scene in a hurry. They must've 
realized something and gone to chase after Winning Ticket.

I don't have a hope of catching up with two Umamusume, but I go 
looking for them anyway.

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text: Ticket! What're you doing?!

I head in the direction of Narita Taishin's voice and find her with Biwa 
Hayahide and Winning Ticket.

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text: This is public training for the DERBY! And you're not running?! What're you hiding from?!

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: Sorry… I didn't mean to hide from anyone.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: But my legs… They just won't budge.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text: You… don't mean you're injured, I take it.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
I'm scared… What if I can't keep up with everyone in public training? 
I…

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text: So that's what's been on your mind since you lost the Satsuki Sho?

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text: To hell with that!

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text:
You lost your nerve after a single defeat?! What happened to your 
gotta-win attitude?!

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text:
I've lost tons of times. And I was freaked out when I saw I couldn't cut 
it!

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text:
But still… I faced my fears and worked my butt off! 'Cause I wasn't 
gonna break our promise!

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text: Ugh, forget it! This sucks!

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
You're not the only one who's scared you know. I continue on in spite 
of my fear.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text: There's nothing more for us to say. It's up to you to clear your head.
The speechless racer watches on as her friends depart.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: To be honest, I didn't realize it'd be this scary…

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: You only get one shot at the Derby… There's no next time…
I sit in the trainers' office that night, thinking about Winning Ticket.
Her dream was born from seeing the Derby up close as a kid.

And chasing that dream, she entered the academy full of hope and 
trained day after day.

She's always run toward her goal without looking back, her desire to 
win the Derby stronger than anyone else's.

And now that she's tasted defeat, she's scared that her dream might 
be crushed.

As I'm reflecting on this, I notice Ticket's Derby notebook on the desk 
and pick it up.

Right there under the photo stickers of the three friends who are 
chasing the Derby together…

There's a message. "I can do it! Only a little more until I become a 
Derby champion!"

Her words from when she held her dream tight, before failure entered 
her mind.
I want her to win. I want her to achieve her dream…
Helping her realize her potential is what a trainer's supposed to do.

I won't fail her. I'll make sure the next entry in her notebook says, 
"Derby champion Winning Ticket and her Derby trainer!"
